newsitem.title: BRAZIL: BRAZIL COOP COFFEE STOCKS RISE TO 1.77 MLN BAGS.
newsitem.headline: BRAZIL COOP COFFEE STOCKS RISE TO 1.77 MLN BAGS.

text.p: Coffee stocks held by Brazilian cooperatives totaled 1.77 million 60.5-kg bags on July 31, National Coffee Council (CNC) said in a statement.
That is up from 1.08 million bags held by cooperatives on June 30 but below the 2.63 million bags held at the end of July 1996.
Sales by cooperatives reached 479,805 bags in July versus 298,835 during June and 721,036 bags in July last year.
Cooperatives received 1.16 million bags of coffee during the month of July against 532,574 bags delivered the previous month and 1.77 million bags received in July 1996, the CNC said.
This brings the May/July total to 1.96 million bags against 2.79 million bags in the same period in 1996.
